title: Clone resume app frontend for separate Hatem23 deployment

requirements.summary: Add frontend-side configuration to support a separately deployable clone named Hatem23 without changing existing app behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: A new, separately accessible deployment exists under the app/domain name "Hatem23".
The existing/original app remains available and unchanged.
The "Hatem23" deployment includes the same frontend pages/sections and the same backend capabilities (recruiter prompt logging, visitor messages, owner panel + CMS, projects, etc.).

file_operations.description: Create a small app configuration module that centralizes deployment-specific metadata (e.g., app name) using build-time environment variables with sensible defaults for the Hatem23 clone.

Wire the new appConfig into the app so runtime labeling (e.g., document title) can be set based on the cloned deployment configuration while keeping all existing resume UI/sections and flows unchanged.
Add a deployment-specific environment file for the Hatem23 clone (e.g., VITE_APP_NAME) to support separate build/deploy configuration for the cloned frontend.

Document the frontend build-time settings needed for the Hatem23 clone (app name and any required canister/config values) to ensure the cloned deployment points to its own backend and remains separate from the original.

requirements.summary: Update cloned app labeling/metadata to display the name Hatem23 while keeping all UI text in English.
acceptanceCriteria: The cloned appâ€™s browser tab/title displays "Hatem23" (or clearly includes "Hatem23").
All user-facing UI text remains English.

file_operations.description: Update the HTML document title metadata so the browser tab/title clearly includes "Hatem23" while keeping the document language and user-facing text English.

Ensure the app sets/maintains the document title at runtime using the centralized appConfig so the title reliably reflects "Hatem23" across navigations/refreshes without changing existing English UI copy.
